sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 15:32): Hi rrodriguez  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 15:32): Hi Sergiu!  
jumpkick joined #xwiki at 15:40  
vmassol\_ left at 15:41 ()  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 15:42): Sergiu, I have to move to a different location in a while. May I do anything useful about the com.xpn.xwiki.objects.LargeStringProperty issue right now?  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 15:43): No, I have all the rights I need now, I should be OK  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 15:47): I'll reconnect ASAP  
rrodriguez left at 16:00 ()

lucaa joined #xwiki at 17:13

rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 17:56  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 17:59): Hi rrodriguez  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 17:59): Can you try changing a few passwords now?  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:00): of course!  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:01): it does work without a glitch!  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:01): great! Thanks!  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:01): Once the password is changed, you get out of XWiki  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 18:02): You're welcome  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:02): I guess this is the desirable behaviour  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 18:02): Yes, since the cookie does not match anymore  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:02): ok  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 18:02): It could be improved in the future, but it's not a priority now  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:02): I get the point  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:03): I hope this issue has helped a bit to improve XWiki!  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:03): :-)  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:04): By the way, I've new issues with 2.0m1 running on Vista. Something related to no-ascii characters. I've no access to this box right now, I'll try again tomorrow morning and send a message to the list  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 18:04): Note that 2.0 uses UTF-8 as the encoding  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 18:04): Make sure you properly configure your database  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:07): I am sure this is perfectly clear in the readme file :-(  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:08): I'll check this tomorrow. I've had no problem with an installation on a Mac OS X box, but I am not able to write and store áéíóú in the Windows Vista one. I'll keep you posted!  
sdumitriu - (14/07/2009 18:08): Yep, most likely a database encoding issue  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:10): One of these days I will get a proper server to install this EPEC Network thing! Thanks for your work!  
rrodriguez - (14/07/2009 18:19): Moving to a new location! Greetings.
